intro: Pectinaria vulgaris, commonly known as the common pectinaria, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in racemes, attracting various pollinators. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
